The fee varies depending on travel distance and remoteness of aetheryte location.<tab><tab>

When your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is reduced to zero, you are <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>KO'd<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and rendered unable to perform any actions. In this state, you are left with two options: either <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>return<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> immediately to your current <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>home point<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or wait for another PC to revive you using an action or spell such as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Raise<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. When in an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>instanced dungeon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you will return to the area entrance.<tab><tab>

In addition to rendering you temporarily <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>weakened<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> after being raised, suffering a KO also severely damages your currently equipped gear. When a piece of equipment's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>durability<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> reaches 0%, its stats drop significantly, so do not forget to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>repair<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> your gear regularly.

Instanced raids come with several rules─including time limits and restrictions on changing classes or jobs. Instanced areas can be left at any time by using an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>exit<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Leave<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, but by doing so, remember that you will be abandoning your party in the process. Exits will also appear after defeating a raid boss, allowing your party easy access out of the area without having to backtrack.<tab><tab>

Once a boss has been engaged, players will be unable to enter or leave the immediate area. Make sure that all your party members are nearby and prepared beforehand, lest you incur their undying wrath.<tab><tab>

If you are KO'd during an instanced raid, you may either have a party member <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Raise<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> you, or choose to return to the instance entrance.<tab><tab>

Your main weapon determines your current class. Changing classes is as easy as equipping a different type of weapon or tool to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Main Hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> slot.<tab><tab>

When playing more than one class or job, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gear sets<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> allow you to save several different combinations of equipment and swap them at your leisure. A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window.<tab><tab>
You now have access to the Armoury system. Quests to unlock other classes can be undertaken by speaking to the receptionist in the corresponding guild.<tab><tab>

It should be noted that, in addition to martial classes, you may also choose to become a Disciple of the Hand─one who synthesizes items from on hand materials─or a Disciple of the Land─one who harvests resources from the field.
Mastering more than one class is the first step to becoming a well-rounded adventurer.<tab><tab>

You are about to enter a special instance. These areas are reserved for important battles which feature unique environmental conditions or powerful boss enemies. Instance objectives can be confirmed in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

For the duration of the battle, you will be unable to pass beyond the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>red line<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> displayed on the field.
You will automatically leave the instance once all quest objectives have been met.<tab><tab>

Important quests used to tell the story of Eorzea and her people are called <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main scenario quests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These tasks are easily distinguishable from others by their unique <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Quests using this icon indicate a task or series of tasks are tied to new duties or features you have yet to unlock.<tab><tab>

There are some <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> which only can be learned by completing specific <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>class quests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. For example, the ranged lancer weaponskill <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Piercing Talon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is acquired by completing the Lancers' Guild quest available at level 15.<tab><tab>

A myriad of items can be bought and sold from vendors all across Eorzea. Purchasing an item is as simple as clicking on an item in a shopkeep's inventory, while selling an item is as simple as dragging an item from your inventory or Armoury Chest. You can also sell items by right-clicking them and selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Sell<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

If you happen to have second thoughts about a sale, you can always <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>buy back<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> your item from the vendor, but only if you have yet to leave the area or log out of the game.<tab><tab>

A myriad of items can be bought and sold from vendors all across Eorzea. Purchasing an item is as simple as selecting an item from a shopkeep's inventory, while selling an item is as simple as selecting an item from your inventory or Armoury Chest and choosing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Sell<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommand menu.<tab><tab>

Right-click on a target to switch to active mode and ready auto-attack. Approach and face the target to start the battle. Two rotating <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>arrows<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear over the target you are currently attacking.<tab><tab>

Various actions such as spells and weaponskills can be performed by clicking the icons located in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> on the bottom of your screen. These actions can also be initiated using the shortcut keys indicated in the upper left-hand corner of each icon.<tab><tab>

Most actions require magic points (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>MP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) to execute, in addition to having recast times of various lengths. Detailed information on an action can be viewed by mousing over its icon.<tab><tab>

Disciples of Magic and Disciples of War who specialize in ranged attacks (such as archers) are best suited fighting their targets from a distance. The range and radius of an action can also be confirmed in the help window.<tab><tab>

Since the Armoury system in FINAL FANTASY XIV allows you to change your class or job by simply changing the weapon or tool in your main hand, it is recommended that you always have several sets of gear on hand. However, gear can take up a tremendous amount of space in one's inventory, which is why all adventurers carry an <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>Armoury Chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

All gear purchased, crafted, or found is automatically stored in this chest, leaving your inventory free to fill with other items such as potions, crafting materials, and food.
Gear in your Armoury Chest is categorized and sorted by type, and can be equipped or discarded directly from the chest interface.<tab><tab>

The Armoury Chest can be accessed at any time by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the main menu followed by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Armoury Chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, or pressing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Ctrl+I<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

The Armoury Chest can be accessed at any time by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the main menu followed by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Armoury Chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

A crescent moon icon will appear to the right of your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>experience bar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> whenever you enter a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>sanctuary<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. While in this special area, you will accrue a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>rested bonus<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The bonus will continue to grow even if you are offline.<tab><tab>
All experience earned through battle, crafting, and gathering while under the benefit of the rested bonus will be increased by 50%.<tab><tab>

Your current rested bonus is displayed on top of your experience bar. The dark orange bar shows how much more experience can be earned before the bonus fades. If the bar is blue, it indicates your bonus will carry over to the next level.<tab><tab>

Inns in cities, as well as various outposts and settlements, are classified as sanctuaries. To maximize your experience-earning potential, make it a habit to always log out in one of these areas.<tab><tab>

You have formed a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with another player! Parties make it possible to tackle challenges that would be impossible to overcome alone, such as defeating powerful enemies or exploring perilous dungeons.<tab><tab>
The Party chat mode can be used to communicate solely with the other members of your party. You can change your chat mode at any time via the speech bubble icon located below the chat log.<tab><tab>

While in a party, a list of your party's members is displayed on the left side of the screen. This can be used to quickly identify each member's current condition. You can also target party members by clicking on their name in the list. This is especially helpful when there are many objects on the screen and it is difficult or time-consuming to target a member by ordinary means.<tab><tab>

Your party will sometimes be awarded boosts to various attributes based on class and job combinations. If your party is receiving one of these bonuses, it will be indicated by a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>party bonus icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> located above your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>party list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The bonus is nullified if you leave your party for another area.<tab><tab>

Remember, your party members are all the in-game embodiment of real, living people, and chances are you will see them again online. Karma is alive and well in Eorzea. Treat people well, and your life in Eorzea will be a pleasant one. Treat them poorly, and it will come back to you.<tab><tab>

While in a party, a list of your party's members is displayed on the left side of the screen. This can be used to quickly identify each member's current condition. You can also target party members by pressing <var 08 E4E96B64 ((up and down on the D-pad)) ((the up and down buttons)) /var> to select their names from the list. This is especially helpful when there are many objects on the screen and it is difficult or time-consuming to target a member by ordinary means.<tab><tab>

Select a target with <var 08 E1E94C01 ((the directional buttons)) ((the d-pad)) /var> and press confirm once to target it. Press confirm a second time to switch to active mode and ready auto-attack. Approach and face the target to start the battle. Two rotating <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>arrows<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear over the target you are currently attacking.<tab><tab>

Various actions such as spells and weaponskills can be performed by using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>cross hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> on the bottom of your screen.
※The cross hotbar is only available in <var 08 E1E94C01 ((controller)) ((gamepad)) /var> mode.<tab><tab>

The actions set to your cross hotbar can be initiated via the corresponding button combination, which consists of holding one of the <var 12 0F /var><var 12 10 /var> buttons and pressing <var 08 E4E96B64 ((one of the D-pad)) ((one of the directional)) /var> or <var 12 0C /var><var 12 09 /var><var 12 0A /var><var 12 0B /var> buttons.
※When a new action is learned, it will be automatically added to your cross hotbar.<tab><tab>

Most actions require magic points (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>MP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) to execute, in addition to having recast times of various lengths.
Though MP slowly regenerate over time, there exist items and actions which can be used to immediately restore them.<tab><tab>

Some quests will require you to deliver items. If an NPC requires an item, an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Item Request<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window will appear. Drag the items from your inventory or Armoury Chest into the Item Request window and click <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hand Over<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to complete the transaction. Items can also be added to the Item Request window by right-clicking them.<tab><tab>

Some quests will require you to deliver items. If an NPC requires an item, an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Item Request<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window will appear. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Player Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> feature found under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Social<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be used to easily and instantly locate other logged-in player characters (PCs). Searches will list up to 200 results, starting with the ones which are physically closest to your own character.<tab><tab>

Selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Search Conditions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will open a new window in which you can specify the conditions of your search to produce more accurate results. Options include partial name searches for both first and last names, as well as searching by online status, class, level, location, or languages spoken. Press the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Execute<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to initiate your search.<tab><tab>

If there are any players who meet the conditions specified, they will be displayed in the social window. You can right-click on player names to view their search info.
You can adjust your own search info by selecting the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party Members<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tab in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, right-clicking your own name, and selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Edit Search Info<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

To allow your character to be included in searches for multiple classes, first change your online status to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Looking for Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, then select the corresponding icons. If no class is highlighted, then you will only be included in searches for your current class.<tab><tab>

Your current class and any selected classes will have a border. This indicates to other players that while you may have other classes at your disposal, these are the particular ones you wish to play as.<tab><tab>

If there are any players who meet the conditions specified, they will be displayed in the social window. You can select player names to view their search info.
You can adjust your own search info by selecting the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party Members<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tab in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, selecting your own name, and choosing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Edit Search Info<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommand menu.<tab><tab>

Your current class and any selected classes will have a border. This indicates to other players that while you may have other classes at your disposal, these are the particular ones you wish to play as.<tab><tab>

Limit breaks are powerful actions which are only available to parties of four or more members. The actions can be executed when the party's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>limit gauge<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is full. The gauge is located directly above the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>party list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

The limit gauge will slowly fill as battle progresses, while certain acts of heroism─such as curing an ally while they are on the brink of death, or preventing an enemy from using its special attack─will cause the gauge to rise quicker.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Limit Break<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> trigger is located in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Actions & Traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> menu under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>General<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. It can be set to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for easy access.
There are five different types of limit breaks: single-target attack (melee), attack to all targets in a straight line (ranged), area of effect attack (caster), increase party defense (tank), and HP restoration (healer). Which type is used depends on the class/job of the person who initiates the action.<tab><tab>
Limit gauge length varies depending on party size and battle type. The more party members you have, and the more difficult the foe you face, the more options you will have.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Level sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a system which allows players to participate in lower level duties by temporarily adjusting their levels, and is available for most FATEs and instanced raids.<tab><tab>

When your level is synced, not only your personal attributes, but the attributes of your gear will automatically be lowered to meet the requirements set by the duty in which you are participating. Once the duty ends, everything is restored to its original state.<tab><tab>
Experience earned while level synced is based off the synced level, not your current level; however, it will be added to the progress of the latter.<tab><tab>

You have obtained a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soul crystal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>!
Soul crystals are required to change from your current class to a more specialized <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>job<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Each job has its own crystal and arms which can be equipped via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Armoury Chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
While using a job, you will have limited access to actions from other classes. You will, however, have access to new, job-specific actions.<tab><tab>

Job levels coincide with those of the base class. When a job level rises, so, too, does the level of the base class, and vice versa.
Jobs that do not have a base class, however, will start from the level required to unlock them, and their level can be raised independently of other classes and jobs.<tab><tab>
You have obtained an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>untradable<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> item. This item is yours, and yours alone, and cannot be sold or traded.<tab><tab>

Some items can be used, granting various effects such as instant HP restoration, attribute boosts, and more. Using an item is as simple as selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Use<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the item's subcommands.<tab><tab>

All items with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>recast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> timers cannot be used again until the timer has expired.
Items you use often can be set to your hotbar for easy access.<tab><tab>

Linkshells are chat groups which allow for quick and easy communication between players who are not necessarily in a party or free company.<tab><tab>

Linkshells can have up to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>128<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> members, while players may possess as many as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>eight<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> separate linkshells.<tab><tab>

Upon reaching level 10, you will be allowed to rent chocobos from stables across Eorzea. Chocobos can be used for speedy transport to areas which are not readily accessible via aetheryte.
While riding, you will have complete control over the chocobo until you either dismount, enter deep water, are attacked, or the rental period expires.<tab><tab>

While on chocoback, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chocobo icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear near your status effects bar indicating how much time is remaining before the rental period expires. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Dismount<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will return to his stables, regardless of how much time is remaining.<tab><tab>

While on chocoback, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chocobo icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear near your status effects bar indicating how much time is remaining before the rental period expires. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Dismount<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo will return to his stables, regardless of how much time is remaining.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Porters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are similar to rental chocobos in that they can be hired to carry you quickly to various destinations, the differences being that you cannot control these birds, and that they will not stop until they have arrived at their destination. On the other hand, porters are trained to take the safest route, meaning that they will never be attacked while in transit.<tab><tab>

While mounted, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chocobo icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear in your status effects bar. You can end your ride at any time by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Dismount<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the pet hotbar. Be aware, however, that once you have dismounted, the chocobo or falcon will continue on to his destination, leaving you behind.<tab><tab>

While mounted, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chocobo icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear in your status effects bar. Unlike rental chocobos, there is no time limit regulating how long you may remain on chocoback. Remember, however, there are areas, such as highly populated cities and narrow dungeons, that your chocobo will refuse to enter.<tab><tab>

The action to summon your chocobo can be set to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and is located within your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mount Guide<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> found under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
If you are attacked while on chocoback, your steed may buck you and run off to safety. You may only summon him again once the immediate threat has been neutralized.<tab><tab>

Chocobo armor, or “barding,” can be equipped via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Companion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> interface situated in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Use the chocobo whistle to summon your steed again.<tab><tab>

In addition to riding him, you can also summon your chocobo to fight alongside you. To do so, you will first require a bunch of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gysahl greens<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. This chocobo favorite can be purchased in stores.<tab><tab>

To summon your chocobo, simply <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Use<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> the greens. Chocobos gain experience points and grow just as you do in combat, but they can only fight in the same places in which they can be ridden. When traveling the world alone, your feathered companion may turn the tide when fighting enemies of a comparable level.<tab><tab>

Once summoned to battle, your chocobo will remain with you for 30 minutes (Earth time), or until he suffers injuries grievous enough to make him flee.
To give your companion orders, use the commands located under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Orders<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the Actions & Traits interface.<tab><tab>

To order your chocobo to auto-attack, simply select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Free Stance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. You can dismiss your companion at any time by selecting the command <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Withdraw<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Use another bunch of gysahl greens to summon your steed again.<tab><tab>

As your chocobo's rank increases, he will earn skill points (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>SP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>). These points can be used to acquire new companion-specific actions and traits.<tab><tab>

There are three different skill trees you can choose for your chocobo: <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Defender<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Attacker<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Healer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. When your chocobo acquires his first skill from any of these trees, he will also learn that tree's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>stance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Activating the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Defender Stance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will turn your chocobo into a defensive-minded stalwart. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Attacker Stance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will transform your chocobo into an offensive force. Finally, the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Healer Stance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will have your chocobo focus on restoring your HP rather than participating in battle.<tab><tab>

How you choose to use your chocobo's skill points is entirely up to you, but remember─once an action or trait has been purchased, that purchase cannot be undone. Think about how you wish to use your chocobo in battle and choose its path of progression wisely.<tab><tab>

Free companies are independent player-operated organizations, not unlike guilds. While there are no restrictions on who may join a company, players cannot belong to more than one free company at a time.<tab><tab>

Companies will advance in rank as their members earn <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company points<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by undertaking various duties around Eorzea. These tasks will also earn companies <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>credits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which can be used as currency to purchase various items.<tab><tab>
To form a company, a player must first draft a petition and then get three other players to sign it. These three players will become the founding members of the company.<tab><tab>

Here you can view company and member data, messages, and other important information.
Each member is assigned a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>rank<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, each with various levels of <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>authorization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Depending on your rank, you may or may not be able to access such features as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>promoting<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> current members or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>inviting<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> new players.<tab><tab>

As company members participate in various duties around Eorzea, they will not only earn experience points for themselves, but points for their free company as well. As company points are earned, the free company will increase in rank. As rank increases, new features such as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company crests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, an expanded <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>housing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> become available.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a communal depository where free company members can store their excess gear and items. It can be accessed not only from the company's estate, but from Grand Company headquarters, and other convenient locations. Access rights are set by company leaders and can range from full access to all members to restricted access for a select few.<tab><tab>

As the company increases in rank, additional compartments will be added to the chest, increasing the number of items which can be stored within.
Remember, unlike your personal inventory, the company chest is shared. To avoid misunderstandings with fellow company members, refrain from using the chest to store important personal effects.<tab><tab>

Your free company can now create its own unique <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company crest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. To edit the company crest you must first have <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>authorization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to do so. Next, you must speak with an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>OIC officer of arms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> located at one of the three Grand Company of Eorzea headquarters.<tab><tab>

Once your company has attained the proper rank, you will have the opportunity to apply the crest to pieces of armor for all the realm to see. Be advised, however, that company crests cannot be applied to certain armor. This can be confirmed via the item's help window.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Company Actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be used to temporarily increase the statuses of all online company members. They can be accessed under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Free Company<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> interface.<tab><tab>

Actions can be purchased from <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>OIC quartermasters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>company credits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The higher your company's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>standing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with its Grand Company of allegiance, the fewer credits the actions will require.<tab><tab>

To purchase, execute, disable, or discard actions, you must first have been granted the proper company <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>authorization<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to do so.<tab><tab>

Speaking with a local distributor of guildleves, known as a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>levemete<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, will bring up a list of available levequests. Highlight a quest to display its objectives, and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Accept<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to add the quest to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Leve allowances<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are required to accept levequests. You will be granted three leve allowances every 12 hours (Earth time), up to a maximum of 100.
You may accept as many as 16 levequests at once.<tab><tab>

To initiate a levequest, first open your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, or by pressing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>J<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> on your keyboard. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.<tab><tab>

Clicking on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.<tab><tab>
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and click on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Initiate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to begin your duty.<tab><tab>

To initiate a levequest, first open your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Next, select the levequest to bring up a detailed description of its objectives and its rewards.<tab><tab>

Selecting the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button will show the approximate location of the levequest's objectives. Though you can initiate a levequest at any time while in the corresponding area, it is recommended that you wait until you are close to the objectives before doing so. This will increase your chances of becoming eligible for completion bonuses.<tab><tab>
Once you have arrived, open the journal, select the levequest, and press the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Initiate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to begin your duty.<tab><tab>

When you initiate a levequest, you will be given the opportunity to adjust its difficulty. The greater the difficulty setting, the higher the level target enemies will be. Difficulty also affects completion rewards.<tab><tab>

Levequest difficulty can be lowered at any time during the course of the duty by selecting the quest name in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Difficulty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Please note that levequest difficulty cannot be raised once the duty has been initiated.<tab><tab>

Once you have initiated a levequest, the location of your quest objectives will be displayed on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Levequest targets can also be identified by the distinguishing icon displayed above their names.<tab><tab>

During a levequest, the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is replaced with information regarding quest objectives, leve difficulty, time remaining, and more. Rewards are only granted to those who complete all the objectives listed within the time allotted.<tab><tab>

When all levequest objectives have been completed, you will be given the option to return immediately to the issuing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>levemete<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and collect your reward.<tab><tab>

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and pressing the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Retry<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>leve allowance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

If you fail to complete the levequest objectives within the allotted time, you can always rechallenge the quest by selecting it in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and pressing the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Retry<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button. Rechallenging a levequest will cost one <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>leve allowance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Tradecraft<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Hand) are governed by a different set of rules than their <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>battlecraft<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). For example, tradecraft leves have no time limit, and are considered complete when the items requested have been delivered to the client. Information on leve objectives as well as the client's name can be viewed in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

After assembing all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Drag the items from your inventory into the Item Request window and click <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hand Over<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to complete the transaction. For tradecraft leves, submitting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HQ<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items will earn you a greater reward.<tab><tab>

After assembling all the requested items, speak with the client to bring up the Item Request window. Select the items from your inventory to add them to the Item Request window and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hand Over<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to complete the transaction. For tradecraft leves, submitting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HQ<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items will earn you a greater reward.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Fieldcraft<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> leves (guildleves for Disciples of the Land) follow the same set of rules as their <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>battlecraft<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> counterparts (guildleves for Disciples of War and Magic). There are, however, two main differences: you cannot begin a fieldcraft levequest unless you have changed to the corresponding class, and you must perform these tasks solo.<tab><tab>

Leves for <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Fishers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, on the other hand, follow the same set of rules as tradecraft leves, in that you will be required to deliver your catch to the client in person. Selecting the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button will show the approximate location of the desired catch. After obtaining all the requested items, speak with the client to hand them over and collect your reward.<tab><tab>

Once a leve has been initiated, its objectives will appear in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Fieldcraft leve objectives range from visiting specified locations to gathering the specified number of items, all within the allotted time limit.<tab><tab>

After gathering the specified items at the required level, certain levequests will grant bonus rewards depending on your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>evaluation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> score. Levequest targets are indicated with a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>leve plate icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> displayed above their <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>display names<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The general location of targets is also marked on your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
If you possess the same guildleve as the one activated by your party, a leve link will occur, ensuring that you receive full recompense upon completing the quest.<tab><tab>

FATE is short for <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Full Active Time Event<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. These public quests occur periodically in real time around Eorzea, and anyone can participate by simply showing up before one ends. When you sense a FATE nearby, a message will appear on your screen, and the location will be displayed on your maps.<tab><tab>
The type of FATE in progress can be identified by its map icon. Mousing over the icon will display the FATE title.<tab><tab>

You will automatically join a FATE the moment you cross the event threshold. At this time, the FATE title, objectives, and time remaining will appear in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

If you are several levels higher than the recommended level, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Level Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button will appear in your duty list. Press the button to automatically lower your level so that you may participate and receive rewards.<tab><tab>

Once a FATE is complete, a window detailing your reward will be displayed. Rewards are distributed to all event participants and are based not only on success, but on individual contributions.<tab><tab>

The more active you are in completing event objectives, the greater your contribution will be deemed. Contribution is indicated via the gold, silver, or bronze medal that appears on your reward window.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Guildhests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are special operations organized by Adventurers' Guilds and overseen by NPCs known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>battlewardens<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Speaking with a battlewarden displays a list of all guildhests currently available. Please note, however, that each operation has conditions (such as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>level<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>class<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) that must be met by all party members before the duty can be commenced.<tab><tab>

At first, you may find that only a limited number of guildhests are accessible, but do not worry. As you progress in level, that number will grow.
Guildhests can also be accessed via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, removing the hassle of having to try and gather a party.<tab><tab>

Once you have commenced a guildhest, the operation's objectives and the time remaining to complete them will appear in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Hints helpful to completing guildhest objectives will sometimes appear on-screen. These hints will also be added to the duty list after being displayed.
If you are unable to complete the objectives within the allotted time, the guildhest will be deemed a failure.<tab><tab>

While participating in guildhests, you may notice areas that are colored differently than the surrounding landscape. This color is to warn players that stepping into the hazardous zones will trigger new enemies to appear. Take care when passing nearby.<tab><tab>

If you are KO'd while participating in a guildhest, you will be given the option to return to the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>starting point of the operation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, rather than all the way back to your home point.<tab><tab>

If you successfully complete all guildhest objectives in the time allotted, you will be eligible for a reward. Speak with the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>battlewarden<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> overseeing the operation to collect it. If your party can complete the objectives without suffering a single casualty, you will be rewarded a special bonus.<tab><tab>

You are now able to change your Grand Company of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>allegiance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. To proceed with the necessary paperwork, speak with a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>personnel officer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> at any of the Grand Company headquarters.
Do note that upon changing allegiances, all assets (company seals) will be frozen, and some items, such as company-specific gear, may no longer be equippable. Furthermore, there is a cooling-off period of 15 days during which time you will be unable to apply for another transfer.<tab><tab>

You can now craft items using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Quick Synthesis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Quick synthesis is available for any item you have successfully crafted at least once using traditional methods, and can significantly reduce the amount of time required to create multiple normal-quality items.<tab><tab>

To begin quick synthesis, open your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>crafting log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, select the desired recipe, and then press the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Quick Synthesis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to the immediate left of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Synthesize<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button.<tab><tab>
As quick synthesis only focuses on completing the recipe as fast as possible, it is difficult to produce high-quality items. If quality is your aim, normal synthesis is recommended.<tab><tab>

All Disciples of the Hand receive a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>crafting log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> which contains the recipes of every item they can synthesize. The crafting log can be opened by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Logs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
To begin synthesis, you must first select the crafting class and level tier of the item you wish to create.<tab><tab>

Once you have highlighted the item, confirm if you possess all the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>materials<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> necessary in your inventory. If you do, select the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Synthesize<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to begin the crafting process.<tab><tab>
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are used to proceed.<tab><tab>

Successfully crafting an item entails executing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Synthesis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> actions to achieve 100% <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>progress<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> before material <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>durability<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> reaches zero.<tab><tab>
If durability reaches zero before progress has reached 100%, the synthesis will fail and some of the materials may be lost.<tab><tab>
Items that you have successfully crafted at least once will appear with a check mark on their icons. Crafting an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.<tab><tab>
Crafting is similar to battle in that various <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are used to proceed.<tab><tab>

Increasing an item's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>quality<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> during synthesis improves chances that the resulting product will be of a higher grade (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HQ<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).<tab><tab>

Quality is normally improved by using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Touch<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>CP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) to execute.<tab><tab>
The higher the overall quality of a completed item, the higher the experience point reward will be.<tab><tab>

Quality is normally improved by using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Touch<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> actions. However, in addition to reducing material durability, these actions also require crafting points (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>CP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) to execute.<tab><tab>
As synthesis progresses, material <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>condition<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will fluctuate between excellent and poor.<tab><tab>

Using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Touch<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> actions when condition is either <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>good<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>excellent<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will result in greater increases in quality when the action is successful. Note, however, that in the following step, material condition will always drop to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poor<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Every time you use an action, receive damage, or suffer a KO, the gear you have equipped is damaged. When your gear's condition reaches 0%, its functionality drops off severely.<tab><tab>

Gear condition can be viewed by selecting Character under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The vertical bar situated next to each gear icon indicates approximate condition. An exact percentage can be viewed in the item help text by mousing over the icon.<tab><tab>

NPCs conducting item repairs are indicated on your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by a hammer icon. For a small fee, they will restore an item's condition to 100%.<tab><tab>

Disciples of the Hand have the ability to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>repair<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> their own items. To begin mending an item, select its icon and choose Repair.<tab><tab>

Each item has class and level restrictions on who can repair it. This information can be viewed in an item's help text. In addition to meeting these restrictions, Disciples of the Hand must also use the proper grade of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>dark matter<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to complete the repairs. Dark matter can be purchased from Grand Company quartermasters.<tab><tab>

You have obtained a high-quality item! HQ items can be identified by their icon, as well as by the special mark that appears after their name.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HQ<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> gear will often have better stats than normal-quality items, while HQ materials used in synthesis will sometimes yield better results. These features make them more attractive to prospective buyers, resulting in higher selling prices.<tab><tab>
HQ items cannot be stacked with normal-quality items.<tab><tab>

You have obtained a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>unique<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> item.
As this item is special, you can never possess more than one at a time.<tab><tab>
An item you have equipped is now <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>bound<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to you and can no longer be traded or put up for sale in the markets.<tab><tab>

Most items can be sold and traded freely before they are used in battle, crafting, or gathering. This is true regardless of whether or not they have been equipped. However, performing one of these three actions after equipping a new piece of gear will bind the item to you, preventing future trade or sale to other players (NPC shops will still purchase bound items).<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>markets<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are a venue in which players from across the realm can either sell their own items using hired hands known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>retainers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or purchase the items of another. The markets can be accessed by targeting and selecting one of the many <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>market boards<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> conveniently located throughout Eorzea's towns and city<var 1F /var>states.<tab><tab>

The markets of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, Ul'dah, Ishgard, Kugane, and the Crystarium are all connected, meaning that items put up for sale in one city<var 1F /var>state can be viewed as well as purchased by players accessing the markets in a second city<var 1F /var>state.<tab><tab>

Sifting through the sheer number of items up for sale in the markets can prove an overwhelming task for those not familiar with the system. As most gear required for the first few levels of any class can be easily found at local NPC-run shops, it is recommended that players start here, and then work their way to the markets once they feel those shops can no longer meet their needs.<tab><tab>

Before you can purchase an item from the markets, you must first find it. There are two different ways you can do this─one involves doing a direct search by typing in the name of the item you seek. The second consists of specifying search conditions to bring up a list of corresponding items.<tab><tab>

If you know the exact name of the item you seek, then you need only type it in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Free Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> box and then press the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button located in the lower left-hand corner of the window. Typing an incomplete entry will bring up all items that begin with those letters. For example, typing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Boarskin Cr<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will display both Boarskin Crakows and Boarskin Crakows of Gathering.<tab><tab>

If you would rather list all items that fall under a certain category, start by specifying search conditions from <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Main Arm<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Armor<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Items<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> located under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Category Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. For example, if you wanted to view all footwear equippable by level 35 archers, you would first click on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Feet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> icon under Armor, set the level indicator to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>35<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and then finally click the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Search <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button.<tab><tab>
If there are any matches to your search, they will be displayed in the window to the right. The number to the right of the name indicates how many of the item are available for purchase.<tab><tab>
If an item in the search list is available for purchase, you can select the icon to bring up a second list indicating the item's selling prices, ordered from lowest to highest.<tab><tab>

Select the item you wish to buy to display a final prompt from which you can confirm or cancel the transaction.
Please note that you will be charged a transaction fee when completing a purchase.<tab><tab>

If you have a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>retainer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in your employ, you can have them place items up for sale in the markets. A <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>5%<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tax is charged to every sale.<tab><tab>

To put an item up for sale, you must first entrust it to your retainer. Next, select the item from their inventory and decide upon a selling price. The number listed in the list represents the buying price offered by NPCs.<tab><tab>

Items that are <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>untradable<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>bound<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to you cannot be sold to other players, therefore you will be unable to move them from your retainer's inventory to the Market window.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Summoning bells<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are used to call forth any retainers you have in your employ. Retainers are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to maintain items and gil, as well as place goods up for sale in the markets.<tab><tab>

Once you have been given approval to hire retainers, speak with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Frydwyb<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Limsa Lominsa, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Parnell<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Gridania, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Chachabi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Ul'dah, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Prunilla<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Ishgard, or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Kazashi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Kugane.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Retainers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are helpful NPCs who can be hired by players to carry out such tasks as storing excess gil and gear, or selling unwanted items on the markets. They may also be sent afield on <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>ventures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

A contract of service can be drafted by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Frydwyb<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Limsa Lominsa, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Parnell<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Gridania, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Chachabi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Ul'dah, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Prunilla<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Ishgard, or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Kazashi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in Kugane.<tab><tab>

Once a retainer is summoned, you can entrust them with gil or items, as well as have them put entrusted items up for sale in the markets. Additionally, you can also send them afield on <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>ventures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

To entrust an item to or retrieve an item from your retainer, simply drag it from one inventory window to the other. To transfer gil, click on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Gil Transfer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button to open a separate window.
To entrust stackable items that are identical to those already possessed by your retainer, select the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Entrust Duplicates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button.<tab><tab>
Some gathering points will possess certain characteristics that, when exploited, may increase overall yield, or number of gathering attempts.<tab><tab>

Gathering point characteristics are displayed directly beneath a point's integrity bar, but only can be seen after acquiring one of the Disciple of the Land <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Whisperer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> traits.<tab><tab>

The higher your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>perception<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating, the better chance you have of obtaining high-quality (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>HQ<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) items while gathering.
(Some items do not have an HQ counterpart.)<tab><tab>

You can use the Disciple of the Land action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Preparation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to confirm how high your perception rating must be before you are able to obtain HQ items. The percentage displayed in the gathering interface indicates your chance of success.<tab><tab>

Using certain actions or meeting certain attribute conditions can increase your chances of finding HQ items, but only if your perception rating is sufficient enough to obtain HQ items in the first place.<tab><tab>

Botanists can use hatchets and other cutting tools to log the forests of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Trees that are prime for logging are known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>mature trees<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Triangulate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, right-click it to begin logging.<tab><tab>

Mature trees are only discernible from other foliage when using the action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Triangulate<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. While this action is active, the location of mature trees is displayed on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Once you have arrived at a mature tree, target and select it to begin logging.<tab><tab>
As many as eight different types of items can be found on a single gathering point. Begin gathering by selecting an item from the list that appears after right-clicking the target.<tab><tab>

Your chances of successfully obtaining the selected item are displayed as a percentage to the right of its icon. Gear with a high <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gathering<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating will improve these chances, but only if your class level is at or above the item level (also displayed to the right of the item icon).<tab><tab>

An item's position on the list is determined by its type. For example, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>branches<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are always found in the third slot. Remembering which type of items are located in which slots will help you when coming across a new type of mature tree.<tab><tab>

A list of items available through gathering can be viewed by opening the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gathering log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. This feature is accessible via <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Logs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Items that you have successfully gathered at least once will appear with a check mark on their icons. Gathering an item for the first time will earn you a special experience point bonus.<tab><tab>
Certain items can only be obtained in certain areas. To confirm where an item might be found, refer to your gathering log.<tab><tab>

The Disciple of the Land action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Sneak<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked. Be mindful, however, that this ability is not effective against enemies with a level significantly higher than your own.<tab><tab>

The one drawback to this command is that it reduces movement speed by almost half, so when there are no threats nearby, it is recommended that you cancel the status by selecting the Stealth icon on your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> once again.<tab><tab>

Stealth cannot be used if you are being attacked by an enemy. Also, enemies with levels significantly higher than yours may be able to detect you, regardless of whether or not you have Stealth activated.<tab><tab>

The Disciple of the Land action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Stealth<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> allows you to conceal yourself from enemies so that you may log, mine, or fish without fear of being attacked.<tab><tab>

In addition to logging, botanists can use secondary tools to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>harvest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items from patches of foliage referred to as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>lush vegetation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. To harvest, you must first equip a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>scythe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>off hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Scythes can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.<tab><tab>

You have obtained a whistle with which you can summon your very own minion! To learn the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Call Minion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action, you must first <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Use<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> the whistle.<tab><tab>

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.
Minions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.<tab><tab>

While minions do not generate any enmity, neither will they participate in battle. If you are KO'd, your minion will simply wander off back to wherever it is it rests until you call upon it again.<tab><tab>

Once you have used the item, a new entry will appear in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Minion Guide<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu. You can either initiate the action from this menu, or set it to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>cross hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and initiate it from there.<tab><tab>

To send your minion away, simply re-select the summoning icon.
Minions can be summoned or dismissed at any time, and the whistle has no recast timer. Once you have learned the summoning action, you will never lose it, and it can be used with all classes or jobs. You can only summon one minion at a time.<tab><tab>

You are now able to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>dye<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items! To dye a piece of gear, you must first have the proper colorant. Colorant can be crafted or purchased in stores.<tab><tab>

If you wish to paint a housing fixture or furnishing, you can do so by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Furnishing Color<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by accessing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Housing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> within the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Social<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> menu. Alternately, furnishings can also be painted when selected from the inventory.<tab><tab>

You can now extract materia from items!
Materia extracted from one piece of gear can be affixed to another, improving its attributes.<tab><tab>

To extract materia from an item, you must have first created a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>spiritbond<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with it by using the piece repeatedly in battle, crafting, or gathering. Once an item's spiritbond reaches 100%, you will be able to select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Extract Materia<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the list of available subcommands.<tab><tab>

Once materia is extracted from an item, its spiritbond will be reduced to 1%.
Affixing materia to an item can be done by a Disciple of the Hand with the proper training, or by speaking with materia melder NPCs. Should you wish to remove materia, you may do so by highlighting it and selecting <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Retrieve Materia<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

You can now meld materia to items!
Gear can be enhanced significantly by affixing materia to the slots available on most weapons, tools, and armor. The number of slots available on a piece of gear can be confirmed by viewing its help text.<tab><tab>

To affix materia to an item, highlight a piece of gear and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Meld<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommands. Next, select the materia which you wish to affix. Similarly, should you wish to remove materia, you may do so by highlighting it and selecting <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Remove Materia<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

By learning the general action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Advanced Materia Melding<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you can now attempt to attach materia to gear which has all its materia slots filled.<tab><tab>

While the benefits of having multiple materia attached to your gear can be great, success is not guaranteed, and the consequences for failure can be great for a botched meld will result in the loss of the materia.<tab><tab>
The level of an item also plays a role in who can or cannot enhance the gear, requiring higher level crafters as the level of the item increases.<tab><tab>

If you lack the ability to meld your materia to an item, you may enlist the aid of other players or speak with a materia melder NPC. Another option is to find a similar piece of armor with materia already attached. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>markets<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are a perfect place to find specially crafted items synthesized by Disciples of the Hand from across Eorzea.<tab><tab>

Another option is to find another PC to meld the materia for you. One way to do this is via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Player Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> feature. Once you have found a PC capable of doing the meld and terms have been agreed upon, target the player and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Request Meld<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>subcommands<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

The Disciple of the Land actions <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Truth of Forests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Truth of Mountains<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> enable you to detect <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>unspoiled<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> gathering locations and display their location on the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>minimap<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

These special sites cannot be found with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Lay of the Land<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Arbor Call<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, nor are they always present in the field. Furthermore, they may take hours or days to return once spent.<tab><tab>

Upon successfully gathering an item from one of these locations, the times at which it can be gathered will appear in your gathering log. Proceed with caution, however, as these points are known to dissipate upon abandoning gathering.<tab><tab>

Upon accessing certain high-level gathering points, you may find that items are <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>out of reach<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. To find out what these items are, you will have to spend your turns clearing away excess growth or debris.<tab><tab>
If you are lucky, you may find a rare item. If not, you may find the slot barren. Either way, you will not know until the debris is removed.<tab><tab>

The higher your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gathering<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating, the more debris you will clear with each attempt. There are also high-level actions such as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Toil of the Pioneer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Toil of the Mountaineer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> that, when used, instantly clear away all debris at a gathering point, allowing you to see where the items are located without having to use up your attempts.<tab><tab>

Miners can use pickaxes and other digging tools to mine the mountains of Eorzea and gather materials for use in crafting. Locations that are prime for mining are known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>mineral deposits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Mineral deposits are only discernible from other stones when using the action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Prospect<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. In addition to mining, miners can use secondary tools to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>quarry<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items from patches of stone referred to as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>rocky outcrops<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
