To quarry, you must first equip a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>sledgehammer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>off hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Sledgehammers can be obtained from shops, markets, or quests.<tab><tab>

To fish, you must first change your class to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>fisher<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by equipping a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>rod<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

If the body of water you are near is fishable, the icon for the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Cast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action will glow. Determine a bait to apply to your line by selecting the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Bait<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action and then checkmarking the desired item from the list that appears.<tab><tab>

Some bait can only be used in certain locations or for landing certain types of fish. Bait and tackle can be harvested, made by Disciples of the Hand, or purchased from various merchants or fieldcraft vendors. Always make sure your inventory is stocked before heading out into the wild.<tab><tab>

Your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>fishing log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> contains invaluable information on everything from fishing hole locations, to detailed fish data, to personal records. The log can be found under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Logs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

In addition to bait, there exist several types of man-made <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>lures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Lures are applied to your line in the same manner as bait.
Fish can sense the difference between live bait and lures; therefore it may take longer for you to register a bite.<tab><tab>

On the other hand, lures can be reused multiple times, as well as employed to land prey too large for smaller bait. Being able to choose the right bait or lure for the situation is what separates the amateur from the professional.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mooching<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a technique that involves catching a smaller fish, and then leaving that fish on the line to lure in a larger fish. Mooching can only be attempted after catching a large-sized fish that is <var 1A 02 /var>also<var 1A 01 /var> suitable for mooching.<tab><tab>

There are some varieties of fish that can only be landed via mooching. Increase your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>perception<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating to increase your chances of landing a massive catch, and then use that fish to lure in an even rarer find.<tab><tab>

No water, no problem! In Eorzea, experienced fishers find casting their lines into deserts (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>dunefishing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) and off mountain cliffs (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>skyfishing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) just as rewarding as casting them into a lake or river.<tab><tab>

Once you have learned the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> that unlock these special techniques, you will next need to equip your tackle box with special sky- and dunefishing bait.<tab><tab>

The higher your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>perception<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating, the better chance you have of landing a large-sized fish. Depending on the variety, it may be usable for <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>mooching<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Scattered about Eorzea there are legendary <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>fishing holes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> that only a handful of fishers can recognize amongst the normal waters. Once you have learned <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Gulleye<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, perhaps you, too, can try your luck at these prime fishing locations.<tab><tab>
A treasure coffer has appeared! Ofttimes, leve targets will drop treasure while being pursued. If you don't claim it, someone else will, so what are you waiting for?<tab><tab>

You have discovered a wanted target. While not necessary to complete the leve objectives, defeating the enemy will earn you a portion of the bounty placed on its head. Take care, however, for these targets are usually quite powerful.<tab><tab>

Grand Company leves are special missions available only to Grand Company members, and can only be accepted by speaking to a company officer. Completing one of these levequests will not only earn you items and experience, but company seals as well.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Instanced raids<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are party-based content which take place in closed environments such as dungeons. The term “instanced” refers to the fact that these areas are reserved for a single group of players, meaning that you will not encounter any others during your time in them.
Parties must rely on their own wits and strength to conquer the many challenges that await them, such as deadly traps, complex mazes, and powerful bosses.<tab><tab>

To add to the challenge, instanced raids have numerous requirements such as time limits, level restrictions, and limitations of changing classes or jobs while within.
Finally, raids can be joined either by forming a party and speaking with the NPC at the entrance, or by using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to automatically pair you with other adventurers around the world with the same ambitions.<tab><tab>

Congratulations! You have just received your first <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>achievement<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>! Achievements are earned by reaching certain milestones during your adventures in Eorzea.<tab><tab>

There are achievements for just about everything─from leveling classes and uncovering locations, to defeating enemies and earning gil. There are also rewards granted upon attaining certain achievements. Some of these include rare weapons and armor, others include <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>titles<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> which can be added to your display name to showcase your greatness.<tab><tab>
You can view requirements for unlocking specific achievements or redeem achievement rewards from the Achievements menu in the main menu.<tab><tab>
You can view requirements for unlocking specific achievements or redeem achievement rewards from the Achievements menu in the main menu.<tab><tab>

Recommendations are helpful for finding quick gil and experience, or simply confirming if there are any quests or hunting log targets in the area you might have missed.<tab><tab>

By unlocking the Duty Finder, you can now undertake multiplayer duties without having to form a party on your own.
Press the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>U<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> key or select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to bring up the finder interface.<tab><tab>

By unlocking the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you can now undertake multiplayer duties without having to form a party on your own.

Once you have registered, you can view the duty's particulars, including party and server status, by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

When your party has been successfully formed, a confirmation prompt will appear.

If someone has left your Duty Finder party, you can have the finder locate you a new member by using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Add Member<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> feature. In the event multiple solo players attack the same target, the player who attacks first will <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>always<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> receive <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>100%<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> of the experience points and items dropped. The players who follow will be rewarded based on their contribution to the battle.
If you see a fellow player in need of a hand, do not hesitate to lend yours!<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Melee-oriented<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> classes such as gladiator and marauder can chain together their <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>weaponskills<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to deal additional damage or inflict additional enfeeblements to their targets. This is known as a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>combo<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
※Combos are not available to pugilists, as this melee class employs a unique weaponskill chaining system.<tab><tab>

If a weaponskill can be chained with another, it will be indicated in the weaponskill's help text under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Combo Action<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. In the case of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Vorpal Thrust<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (to the left), if executed immediately after <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>True Thrust<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, the potency will be increased.<tab><tab>
Some weaponskills must be delivered from a specified <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>direction<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to maximize their damage.<tab><tab>

When a weaponskill can be chained into a combo, its <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will be outlined with a flashing yellow border. The border will fade if the weaponskill is not used within a certain amount of time.
Learn which weaponskills chain together to maximize your battle efficiency.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Astral Fire<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Umbral Ice<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are special status effects which allow thaumaturges to continuously deal devastating amounts of damage while still conserving their MP reserves.<tab><tab>

Casting one of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Fire<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Astral Fire, which increases the potency and MP cost of further Fire spells. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Blizzard<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> spells, but prevents the natural or spell-assisted gradual restoration of MP.<tab><tab>

Conversely, casting one of the Blizzard spells gives a thaumaturge the effect of Umbral Ice, which decreases the MP cost of Ice spells and recovers MP upon landing an Ice spell. At the same time, it lowers the potency and MP cost of Fire spells.<tab><tab>

As a thaumaturge progresses in level, the number of Umbral Ice and Astral Fire effects which can be stacked at any one time increases─the larger the stack, the more powerful the effect.
Learning when to switch between fire and ice is key to being successful in extended battles.<tab><tab>

Unlike other melee classes, pugilist weaponskills are used to cycle three unique battle <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>forms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> which dictate the flow of weaponskill combos.<tab><tab>

Many pugilist weaponskills will either change your form upon execution, or require you to be in a certain form to execute. There are also weaponskills which will grant damage bonuses when executed while in a certain form. The three types of forms are as follows: <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>raptor<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>coeurl<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>opo-opo<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

By successfully changing your form from opo-opo to raptor to coeurl, precisely in that order, you will be granted an increase to attack potency, as well as other additional effects based on the weaponskills executed.<tab><tab>
Swiftly flowing from one form to the next as the situation demands is key to becoming proficient in the art of the monk.<tab><tab>

You can now summon a pet to do your bidding! You only have access to one pet now, but there will be opportunities to acquire many more as you continue your adventures.
Cast the spell <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Summon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from your hotbar to complete the arcane pact.<tab><tab>

Once your pet is summoned, a fixed hotbar known as the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pet hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear in addition to your regular hotbars. The pet hotbar is preset with all the pet commands currently available to you, freeing up your normal hotbars for your personal actions and spells.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Guard<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> command orders your pet to guard his master, refraining from acting until you attack or are attacked. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Steady<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> command orders your pet to refrain from attacking until you specifically order him to do so. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Away<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> command orders your pet to leave the battlefield.<tab><tab>

Pet orders and actions can also be set to your other hotbars by selecting them from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Pet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> tab under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Orders<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Actions & Traits<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> menu.<tab><tab>

Once your pet is summoned, a separate hotbar known as the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pet hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be accessed by pressing <var 1E 0E /var>. The pet hotbar is preset with all the pet commands currently available to you, freeing up your normal hotbars for your personal actions and spells.<tab><tab>

You have unlocked <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Crystalline Conflict<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>! The Grand Companies of Eorzea established this new tactical exercise to strengthen their individual members' strategic capacity. Outmaneuver other adventurers just like you in a match of wits to claim victory!
Speak with Gungi Zelungi at the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Wolves' Den<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to learn more.<tab><tab>

When a powerful enemy is readying a special attack during a quest battle, the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>area of impact<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will begin to glow. Leaving the glowing area before the attack is initiated will ensure that you do not suffer any damage.<tab><tab>

If an NPC has joined you in a quest battle, he or she will often provide you with hints displayed in a special text box near the top of the screen. Heed their words and you may just emerge victorious.<tab><tab>

In addition to the reliving of past events and the understanding of unlearned languages, the Echo can provide you with extra strength when a battle turns sour. If you happen to be defeated during a quest battle, when you return for a second attempt, you will find that your attributes have been given a temporary boost.<tab><tab>

Some quests require you to use a key item on an enemy target. There are two ways to do so.
The first is by right-clicking the enemy's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>target bar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Use Key Item<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommands.<tab><tab>
The second method is to first target an enemy, then click on the key item icon found in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Some quests require you to use a key item on an enemy target. There are two ways to do so.
The first is by pressing <var 1E 0B /var> and selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Use Key Item<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommands.<tab><tab>

The second method is to first target an enemy, then press <var 1E 14 /var> to access the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Use the <var 08 E4E96B64 ((D-pad)) ((directional keys)) /var> to select the key item icon and press <var 1E 09 /var> to complete the action.<tab><tab>

You have changed to a new <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>battle class<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>!
To lessen the burden of leveling multiple Disciple of War and Magic classes, an experience point bonus known as the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Armoury bonus<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is added when slaying enemies and participating in FATEs.<tab><tab>

This bonus grows larger the greater the discrepancy between your current level and the level of your highest class. Use this to your advantage when deciding when and how to raise secondary classes.<tab><tab>

Some key items are used on areas rather than single targets. First, click on the item icon displayed in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Upon selecting the item, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>glowing radius<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear on the ground that can be moved freely with the mouse into the desired position before executing.<tab><tab>

Some key items are used on areas rather than single targets. First, press <var 1E 14 /var> to access the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>duty list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Upon selecting the item and pressing <var 1E 09 /var>, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>glowing radius<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear on the ground that can be moved freely into the desired position before executing.<tab><tab>

After using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Cast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action to cast your line into the water, you need simply sit back and wait for a bite. When a fish bites, you will not only see the line being tugged, but hear it. Your chances of successfully reeling in a fish after hooking it are directly affected by the fish type and your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gathering<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> rating.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Allagan tomestones<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are relics of a long-lost civilization which perished several ages past. It is said that they contain the knowledge of the Allagan Empire, and as such are highly sought out by collectors around Eorzea.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Rowena<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and her associates are representatives of one such collector, and have been sent to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Revenant's Toll<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the heart of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mor Dhona<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by her employer to seek out adventurers willing to exchange the tomestones they come across on their journeys for weapons and armor.<tab><tab>

Situated in your inn room, estate, and squadron barracks, the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>armoire<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be used to store certain kinds of items with limited methods of obtainment. These include job-specific gear, seasonal event garb, and so forth. You can determine whether or not an item can be stored in the armoire by viewing its item help window.<tab><tab>

Please note that only items with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>condition<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> at <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>100%<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or above can be stored. Furthermore, storing an item will reset its <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>spiritbond<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and condition, as well as remove customized elements such as dyes and crests.<tab><tab>

Participating in PvP matches will grant you the following three rewards: <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP Exp<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Series Exp<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Wolf Marks<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

You may claim additional rewards outside of PvP matches via <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Series Rewards<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and more. For further information, speak with Storm Captain Berkoeya Loetahlsyn at the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Wolves' Den<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

You can view PvP performance records, available PvP actions, and more by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP Profile<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

You can view PvP performance records, available PvP actions, and more by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP Profile<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Each of the three nations has established a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>residential district<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, wherein like-minded adventurers can establish a base for their activities.<tab><tab>

Each residential district is divided into <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>wards<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which in turn house 60 plots of land each. Wealthy individuals may purchase plots of land upon which to build their own estate halls, while free companies may jointly purchase plots. Those seeking simpler quarters may instead purchase a room in the apartment buildings found in each of the residential districts.<tab><tab>

Estate halls and apartments can be customized by installing fixtures and placing furnishings. Please note that, in the case of estate halls, specific company privileges are required for customization.<tab><tab>

More information on housing can be had by speaking with the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>resident caretaker<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> stationed at each residential district.<tab><tab>

By the entrance of each plot of land, you will find a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>placard<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Interacting with the placard will bring up information on the owner, if available.<tab><tab>

In the event that the plot is for sale, the current price will be displayed along with information as to whether it can be bought via lottery or on a first-come-first-served basis. More information on buying land can be had by speaking with the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>resident caretaker<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> stationed at each residential district.<tab><tab>

This duty is designed to be undertaken by an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>alliance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, a squad of 24 adventurers formed of three <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>full parties<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. This battle composition is reserved for large-scale duties only.<tab><tab>

While you are in an alliance, the class/job icons and HP bars of alliance members will appear to the right of the party list. By joining forces with other parties, you can achieve that which would otherwise be impossible.<tab><tab>

You can receive only one reward item per week for completing duties in the most recent raid. The instant you are awarded an item from the loot list, you relinquish your right to vie for all remaining items regardless of whether you selected <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Need<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Greed<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Completing an objective in duties requiring an alliance will produce three treasure coffers, one for each party. This means that your chance to obtain a reward is no less than that of other duties.
Upon completing all objectives in such duties, players may vie for special items separate from those discovered in treasure coffers. You can only receive one of these special items per week per duty.<tab><tab>

Reward eligibility is reset <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>every <var 07 FD4C9866 /var><var 09 DD ((Sunday)) ((Monday)) ((Tuesday)) ((Wednesday)) ((Thursday)) ((Friday)) ((Saturday)) /var> at <var 08 DB ((<var 09 DB02030405060708090A0B0C0D02030405060708090A0B0C /var>)) 0D /var>:00 <var 08 E3DB0D ((a.m.)) ((p.m.)) /var> (Earth time)<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Duty reward restrictions are listed under Duty Finder information.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> has been added to the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Through the Party Finder, you can either search for a party to join, or recruit other adventurers to form a party of your own.<tab><tab>

To join a party, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Advanced Search<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and specify your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Search Criteria<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Upon finding a compatible party, simply select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Join Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

To recruit adventurers for your own party, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Recruit Members<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and specify your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Recruitment Criteria<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Interested individuals will answer the call, and you need only sit back and wait.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> has been added to the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Through the Party Finder, you can either search for a party to join, or recruit other adventurers to form a party of your own.<tab><tab>
In the course of gathering, Disciples of the Land will occasionally come across <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hidden<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items.<tab><tab>

A hidden item may also be classified as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>rare<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, meaning you can obtain only one before it disappears from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Gathering<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> window. Abilities that increase the number of items obtained during a single gathering attempt have no effect on rare items.<tab><tab>

In the course of gathering, Disciples of the Land will occasionally discover items known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>timeworn maps<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Fishers can only obtain the maps when using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Snagging<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action.<tab><tab>

These tomes can be examined by using the general action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Decipher<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. After a timeworn map is gathered, no further maps can be gathered for a certain period of time. Refer to the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Timers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> interface under Duty in the main menu to check when these maps can be gathered again.<tab><tab>
If you wish to learn more about timeworn maps, it is recommended that you visit Wineport in eastern La Noscea.<tab><tab>

By using the general action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Decipher<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you can examine a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>timeworn map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Doing so will change it into a key item known as a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>treasure map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which, true to its name, will reveal to you the location of a hidden cache of riches.<tab><tab>

Please note that you can only possess one treasure map at any given time. If you wish to decipher another timeworn map, you must either find the current hidden cache, or simply discard the map leading to it.<tab><tab>

Using a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>treasure map<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will bring up a window that reveals the rough whereabouts of a hidden cache. It is then up to you to cross-reference the area map and pinpoint its precise location.<tab><tab>

Upon arriving at the specified location, use the general action <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Dig<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to locate and extract the treasure. Barring any navigational errors, a chest laden with bounty will appear.<tab><tab>
Be fairly warned! The chest may be rigged with a trap that lures ferocious creatures to you. You must defeat them if you are to walk away with life, limb, and loot.<tab><tab>

The societies you encounter in your travels are beset with myriad problems. By helping each community resolve its issues through <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>allied society quests<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you can improve your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>reputation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> among its members. <tab><tab>
The quests that are available change on a daily basis, and you can accept up to twelve in a single day. However, you cannot accept a new quest while the previous day's is still in progress.<tab><tab>

To view your reputation among the allied societies, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Reputation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Character<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> menu. By winning the trust of their members, not only will you gain an insight into their lives, you will also be initiated into their mysteries.<tab><tab>

Completing an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>allied society quest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will improve your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>reputation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with that society. When your reputation has risen sufficiently, you will be able to raise it to the next rank by undertaking a special quest.<tab><tab>
As your bond with the society strengthens, you will be able to purchase an ever-expanding range of items from their vendors.<tab><tab>
These societies deal in wares found nowhere else, and the only way to obtain them is to win their trust!<tab><tab>

Certain duties require you to carry an object and deliver it to a destination. While carrying an object, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>transporting icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear in your status bar. The timer above this icon indicates the amount of time you have left to complete the delivery.<tab><tab>
Receiving damage while transporting incurs a time penalty. If the timer falls to zero, you will drop the object and be unable to continue the duty.<tab><tab>

Through sylphic magicks, you can become <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>transparent<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and infiltrate enemy territory undetected. While in this state, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>transparent icon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear in your status bar. The timer below this icon indicates the amount of time you have left before the enchantment wears off.<tab><tab>
Certain points along your route extend the duration of your transparency; use them wisely while avoiding detection. Be warned that you cannot perform any actions while transparent.<tab><tab>

When riding certain mounts, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pet hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.<tab><tab>

When riding certain mounts, a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pet hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> featuring special actions will appear. These actions can be of great help in certain duties, so use them well.<tab><tab>

You have befriended Jandelaine! By using the crystal bell found in your inn room, you can call upon the services of the flamboyant <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>aesthetician<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

From hair style and color to face paint, he can create a new look for you for a mere <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>2,000 gil<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Whenever you feel like a change, Jandelaine is your man.<tab><tab>

When using the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Roulette<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, you will be assigned a random duty from among those you have unlocked. In return for leaving your destination in the hands of fate, you will receive enhanced rewards.<tab><tab>

Furthermore, should you happen to be an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>adventurer in need<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>─that is to say, your role is in short supply─you will receive an additional bonus.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Vote dismiss<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a function whereby players who are absent for extended periods or harass others can be democratically expelled from the party. To initiate a vote, first select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party Members<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Next, select the party member you wish to nominate for dismissal, then <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Vote Dismiss<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the submenu. You will be required to select a reason for dismissal. Please be warned that unjustified usage of vote dismiss is a punishable act.<tab><tab>

When vote dismiss is initiated, party members will be prompted for their response. If more than half vote <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Yes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, the player in question will be dismissed from the party.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Player commendation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a system whereby you can commend a party member who left a positive impression upon you in the course of duty.<tab><tab>

Upon the conclusion of a duty, the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Player Commendation<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button will appear in the bottom right of the screen. Selecting it will bring up an interface wherein you can commend a player. Please note that commendations cannot be given to those who were in your party at the time of duty registration.<tab><tab>
Commendations can be accumulated over time. By receiving a certain amount, you will unlock achievements that grant special rewards. It pays to play nice!<tab><tab>

You can apply to join a free company from its <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>profile<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> page. Review the company's focus, times active, and the roles it is seeking, then <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>submit<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> your application if you believe you've found a good match.<tab><tab>

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Free Company<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Social<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. From here, you can also <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>withdraw<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> your application should you have a change of heart.<tab><tab>

If your application is approved, you will formally join the company. Review your current application by selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Free Company<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Social<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>challenge log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>challenge log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> contains a list of adventuring objectives across a wide range of categories. Completing any one of these objectives will earn you rewards. Completion status is reset on a weekly basis, and it is possible to undertake the challenges repeatedly.<tab><tab>

Each unique challenge you complete counts towards the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Overall Completion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> category, which yields additional rewards. As you progress in level and advance in the scenario, more challenge objectives will become available, giving you the chance to garner richer bonuses.<tab><tab>

You have obtained a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>master recipe book<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. To learn the advanced recipes contained within, simply use the book in your inventory. The recipes will then appear under the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Master<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> category of your crafting log.<tab><tab>

Glamours allow you to alter the appearance of equipment through the use of illusory magicks. To change the appearance of an item, highlight it and select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Cast Glamour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the subcommands.<tab><tab>

Casting glamours requires catalysts known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>glamour prisms<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Please note that, for the illusion to take effect, the projected gear must be compatible with the glamoured gear's level, class, race, and gender.<tab><tab>

Glamoured items cannot be sold or traded. Furthermore, the item lending its likeness will become bound to you. With these conditions in mind, by using glamours, you can always look <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> perform your best! <tab><tab>

It is possible to grow a diverse variety of plants in both your garden patch and in flowerpots. To get started, you will need to obtain <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>seeds<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soil<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Soil comes in various grades, and influences crop yield and quality.<tab><tab>

Seeds and soil can be obtained through gathering by botanists and miners respectively. Once you have both, you may start growing a plant in an empty flowerpot or empty bed in your garden patch.<tab><tab>
The plants in your garden require constant tending if they are to thrive and yield crops. Plants that are neglected for too long will wither and die.<tab><tab>
Fertilizer can be used to enrich the soil and accelerate growth, and can be applied on any one plant up to once per hour (Earth time).<tab><tab>
Your garden has crops which are ready for harvest. When you harvest a plant and obtain its produce, it will disappear from the garden patch.<tab><tab>

In the event that different plant species were growing side by side in a garden bed, they may also render up new kinds of seeds. Through experimentation, you can look forward to some truly surprising yields!
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Intercrossing cannot be done using flowerpots.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Ventures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are tasks which send retainers afield on procurement expeditions. Retainers can be instructed to either bring back specified items, or explore certain terrains for whatever items may be found, be they riches or refuse. It should be noted that retainers well equipped for their journey may return with greater spoils.<tab><tab>

Assigning a venture requires a payment in a unique currency of the same name─<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>ventures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Ventures can be acquired through a variety of methods such as exchanging company seals, fulfilling leve objectives, and completing allied society quests.<tab><tab>

Even while on a venture, retainers will promptly answer your call when summoned, and likewise can be sent to tend to your wares at the markets. Be certain to put these resourceful men and women to good use! <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Please note that you will not be refunded any venture payments if you cancel an active venture.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>

One of two main venture types, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>exploration<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> sends your retainer to scour the terrain of your choosing for (hopefully) precious items. There is no telling what he or she will find.<tab><tab>
Indeed, there are certain rare items which can only be obtained through ventures, so make a point of dispatching your retainer as often as your resources allow.<tab><tab>

You can communicate with other players via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat input<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> bar situated below the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press the Enter key.<tab><tab>

You can communicate with other players via the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat input<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> bar situated below the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Having selected the bar, enter your message, then press <var 1E 09 /var>.<tab><tab>

The recipients of your message are determined by the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat mode<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> currently in use. The chat mode is set to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by default. In this mode, your message is sent to all players within a small radius around you.<tab><tab>
The chat mode can be changed at any time via the speech bubble icon located below the chat log.<tab><tab>

Popular chat modes include <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Tell<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which sends a message to a specific player, and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, which sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location.<tab><tab>

The world of Eorzea is home to adventurers of various cultural and linguistic backgrounds. In order to facilitate communication in this diverse environment, the game includes a feature known as the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>auto-translation dictionary<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

To use the dictionary, select the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat input<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> bar situated below the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, then press the Tab key. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.<tab><tab>

To use the dictionary, select the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat input<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> bar situated below the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>chat log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, then press the <var 1E 0E /var> button. A list of auto-translate categories for words and expressions will appear.<tab><tab>

Selecting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>2: 【Greetings】<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and then <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>3: Hello!<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will produce the text <var 12 37 /var>Hello!<var 12 38 /var> in the chat input bar enclosed in special parentheses.<tab><tab>
When sent, such text will automatically be translated into the client language being used by the recipients.<tab><tab>

The auto-translation dictionary contains a list of everyday words and expressions as well as game-specific terms. We hope that it will prove useful during your adventures with players the world over.<tab><tab>

Should a particular item in the marketplace catch your eye, you can add it to your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>wish list<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. This list can contain a maximum of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>ten<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items at one time.<tab><tab>

The total number of players who fancy a given item will be displayed in search results, providing a quick reference as to current demand.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Please be advised that all wish list data will be cleared when Worlds undergo maintenance.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>

Your retainer can be assigned any one class, with the exception of those of the Disciples of the Hand. While it is possible to reassign classes, please be warned that your retainer's progress in the current class will be reset.<tab><tab>
A retainer's class determines which ventures he or she may embark upon. Retainers gain in level by completing ventures, but their level will never exceed your own. <tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Trials of the Braves<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a collection of sacred texts spanning nine books, each of which contains a series of objectives for enhancing your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>relic weapon atma<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. They can be acquired by exchanging Allagan tomestones with <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>G'jusana<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> at Revenant's Toll.<tab><tab>

Each book will appear in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Key Items<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> section of your inventory. By vanquishing all the foes listed therein with your relic weapon atma equipped, your weapon will undergo evolution.<tab><tab>

Upon fulfilling the objectives of all nine books, your weapon will be ready to complete its evolution and become a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>relic weapon animus<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>─one step closer to one of the transcendent Zodiac Weapons.
※Please note that you can only possess one book at any given time.<tab><tab>

By infusing <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>sphere scrolls<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with the materia of your choice, you can enhance a relic weapon animus as you see fit. To infuse a sphere scroll with materia, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Infuse<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from its subcommands.<tab><tab>

Each sphere scroll can be infused with up to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>seven<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> types of materia, granting a bonus to attributes, casting times, and more. Please note that up to five materia can be infused onto a single scroll. Materia will be consumed upon infusion.<tab><tab>

While grade I materia will suffice for initial infusions, progressively higher grades of materia will be required to enhance an attribute past certain points. Moreover, there are limits as to how many times a given attribute may be enhanced.<tab><tab>

Each infusion requires the use of a catalyst known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>alexandrite<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Alexandrite can be obtained in exchange for Allied Seals or found by traveling to locations marked on <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>mysterious maps<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> obtained through select quests. The material can also be obtained by participating in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>FATEs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with your relic weapon animus equipped.<tab><tab>

Once you have fully infused a sphere scroll with materia, <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Jalzahn<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can use it to enhance the corresponding relic weapon animus.
In the future, it will be possible to undo this process and apply different enhancements, should you so desire.<tab><tab>

The Borderland Ruins located on the outskirts of the Carteneau Flats are now accessible! Control of this ancient Allagan site is decided via large-scale player-versus-player (<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>PvP<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>) battles known as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Frontline campaigns<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Speak with a Grand Company <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>flyer<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> at one of the airship landings for further details.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Repair NPCs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can only restore an item's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>condition<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to 100%. Repairing the same item yourself, however, will raise its condition beyond 100%, allowing for extended use before it wears down again.<tab><tab>

If you meet the class conditions for repairing an item, you need not even change to that class to complete the action.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Item condition is reset to 100% when placed in an armoire.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>sightseeing log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>impressions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

The <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>sightseeing log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is a comprehensive record of breathtaking landscapes and stunning vistas you have discovered across Eorzea. Vistas are often difficult to reach, some requiring sprinting or jumping, and are only recorded upon discovering the exact location noted in Millith's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>impressions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Time of day<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>weather<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are also important to uncovering a vista, as are the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>emotes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> you perform once you have arrived at one. Millith's impressions will often contain hints on these hidden conditions, though you may still need all your wits to discover some of the more obscure entries.
Once an entry is completed, a rough sketch and information on the location's history will be added to your log.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Allied Seals<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> are a type of common currency minted by the three Grand Companies forming the Eorzean Alliance. The seals are most commonly distributed as reward for tracking down and slaying <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>marks<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> designated in the realm-wide <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hunt<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mark bills<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (posted once a day, Earth time) and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>elite mark bills<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> (posted once a week, Earth time) can be accepted at <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hunt boards<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> located across Eorzea. Completing the objectives on these bills will present you with the opportunity to earn even more Allied Seals.
Allied Seals can be exchanged for various weapons and items. Speak with a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Hunt billmaster<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for further details.<tab><tab>

You have acquired a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>toy chest<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> containing several <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>mini-games<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Visit an <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>inn room<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to try your hand at these popular Eorzean pastimes.<tab><tab>

Targeting <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>artillery<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and pressing the confirm button will bring up a temporary <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>hotbar<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> containing a new set of artillery-specific actions.<tab><tab>

Selecting an action will display a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>target circle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> indicating where the siege engine will fire. Position the circle carefully to maximize its effectiveness.<tab><tab>

Every good fisher knows even Nophica's bounty is not limitless, and will therefore return to the water any unwanted catches so that the Matron may take them to Her bosom once more. This is called <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>releasing<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and the action is available to all fishers. Released fish will not be added to your inventory, preserving area populations.<tab><tab>

Once you have released a certain type of fish, you will continue to release that fish should you catch it again in the same location. If you wish to stop releasing fish, you must first end your fishing session and cast your line anew.<tab><tab>

You are now able to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>desynthesize<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> items, reducing them to their original materials! To desynthesize an item, you must first be a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>level 30 Disciple of the Hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Select an item and choose <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Desynthesis<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from its subcommands to begin the dismantling process.<tab><tab>

Each discipline has its own desynthesis <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>skill level<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. If your desynthesis skill is higher than the optimal skill rating for an item, there is an increased chance of receiving rare items.<tab><tab>
You will always successfully desynthesize items regardless of your desynthesis skill level, so never hesitate to desynthesize items you no longer need.<tab><tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Chocobo raising<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is now available! To begin raising your trusty companion, you must first <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>stable<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> him. Chocobo stables can be purchased and placed outside free company and private <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>estates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. One chocobo stable can house a whole company's mounts.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>※Apartment buildings include a chocobo stable that is shared by all tenants.<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var><tab><tab>

While a chocobo is stabled, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Train<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to increase his EXP. After the training is complete, do not forget to give the chocobo a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>reward<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for his hard work. Depending on the type of reward the bird is given, his progress may change dramatically.<tab><tab>

Continuously <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>feeding<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> your chocobo a snack of vibrant vegetables or fruits will cause him to grow feathers of a different color.<tab><tab>

There exist certain fishing holes that are hidden in plain sight, and can only be found after reading the detailed descriptions found in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>tomes of regional folklore<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
You can discern which fish can be found in these elusive fishing holes by viewing your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>fishing log<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Extensive spearfishing is said to, on occasion, upset the balance of the ecosystem in a given area. In fact, it has been known to draw more rare and elusive varieties of fish, often found hiding in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>swimming shadows<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>
Should you suspect such murky waters are close by, you can determine their exact location using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Truth of Oceans<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

You must be a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Disciple of the Hand<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to accept or complete Ehcatl Nine society quests. Items required to complete these quests can only be synthesized after equipping a pair of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Ehcatl wristgloves<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.<tab><tab>

Experience points earned by completing these quests will be allocated to your current class. The amount of experience awarded upon completion can be viewed in your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>journal<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and will automatically update in the event you change your class.<tab><tab>

You will earn <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>quota points<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for each item submitted during an Ehcatl Nine delivery quest. Only by earning enough points will you meet your quota and complete the quest.
